artist: Artist: Wenceslaus Hollar; Artist: After a follower of Hans Holbein the Younger
creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: small group of men at R carry weapons and one man raises a burning candle over Christ, who walks toward R, with back turned away from viewer; man crawling at LL; two men serve a man seated on a throne in back; crucifix stands at R edge
inscription:
Inscription

inscribed in plate at bottom: [See Pilate washing in his Chaire doth sit, / Monkes bring him bread and Cheese and eggs with it / The Popes crosse heere the Crosse of Christ doth threaten, / While hee himself is with a Candle beaten.] 

numbered in plate at lower right: [11]
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Pilate Washing His Hands, From the Satirical Passion
